flawed_nl_solution:
The bedroom set is $2000 and it's currently 15% off so 2000*0.15 = $<<2000*0.15=300>>300 off
So the new price of the set is 2000-300 = $<<2000-300=1700>>1700
He signs up for the credit card so that's 10% off so 0.1*1700 = $<<10*0.01*1700=710>>710
Now the set is 1700-710 = $<<1700-710=990>>990
He has a $200 gift card which brings the price to 990-200 = $790
#### 790

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 170, not 710. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
